claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table listing various influenza vaccines (trade name, manufacturer), their presentations (dosage forms and volumes), age indications, antigen content per dose, administration route, and mercury content. Vaccines are categorized by type: standard-dose egg-based inactivated (IIV4), cell culture–based inactivated (ccIIV4), high-dose egg-based (HD-IIV4), egg-based with MF59 adjuvant (aIIV4), recombinant HA (RIV4), and live attenuated egg-based (LAIV4). does not support the claim because the table provides formulation and dosing details without any information on mutations arising during production or impact on vaccine effectiveness Note: The table text is clear and complete; no mention of mutations or effectiveness concerns is present.
